After all it made me the person I amâ€¦ including all the things I learned, all the things I chose, all my edges, and all the little gems I could collect over time ğŸ™ŒğŸ¼.
.
I like the past. Itâ€™s the only thing that is set in stone. Irrevocable. Isnâ€™t that somehow soothing? Like the purring of a cat .. or the nickering of a horse ğŸ˜.

ğŸ“¿ğŸ¤“ğŸ“–â˜˜ï¸
An often requested pose is #GrassHopperPose aka #DragonFlyPose (and its Baby variation). It took me a while to get it. I only mention hip openers ğŸ™ˆ. I am not necessarily an exhibit A for open hips so this pose eluded me a long time. Until I learned that this is also a deep #twist. All of a sudden this pose was within reach. ğŸ‘‰ğŸ¼Please warm up with your regular practice, add some extra time in hip openers (pigeon, Janu Sirsasana, baby cradle) and twists.
.
ğŸ¬SLIDE 1 Full Pose
.
1ï¸âƒ£ start seated (takes out the balancing element)! Iâ€™m a lazy yogi ğŸ˜‚. Legs in Figure 4. Stay here for some breaths
2ï¸âƒ£ Spine long & tall. Inhale, twist to the left. Bring your arm pit to your foot. Foot is pressing onto the arm, arm is pressing back â†”ï¸
3ï¸âƒ£ Place your hands shoulder width distance at your side. Elbows might splay. SQUEEZE them in (this will lock the foot in place ğŸ”
4ï¸âƒ£ wriggle your left foot closer to your bum. PRESS the pinky edge of the foot into the mat. LEAN a bit forward, STAND up, LIFT your bum. Take a solid stand on the back of your right arm ğŸ‘ŠğŸ¼
5ï¸âƒ£ LEAN forward into Chaturanga. Elbows keep squeezing in. Gaze forward. Stay here OR 
6ï¸âƒ£ EXTEND the left leg straight. No need to wriggle around. Just straighten it from the knee cap
.
ğŸ¬SLIDE 2 If your body is not ready yet work on creating the memory in your body with the baby variation
.
1ï¸âƒ£ start in a cross-legged forward fold (in the pic itâ€™s the left behind the right leg)
2ï¸âƒ£ SHIFT your weight onto the right foot
3ï¸âƒ£ BEND both legs, grab the INNER side of your left foot
4ï¸âƒ£ straighten the left leg, simultaneously bend the right leg even more
5ï¸âƒ£ lower the entire body aka SIT DOWN
6ï¸âƒ£ now bring your right arm in front of your shin; push into your hand, the hand pulls back. Inhale into cow, LEAN forward until your left arm is in Chaturanga
â€¼ï¸Prop up your heels if your calves are not flexible enough yet to allow them to go all the way down. Roll up your mat, use a block/book to stand on
.
ğŸ–SIDE NOTES
ğŸš«Use of body lotion or oil is not recommended ğŸ˜‰
â—ï¸the foot on the arm is always pushing down
.
Hope this helps. Any questions?
.
#yoga #asana #yogatutorial #armbalance #DreasBeginnerTips #DreaIsTeaching

What is a yoga prop? Here is what I found in the internet "A yoga prop is a supportive object used in performing an asana. [...] A yoga prop also helps one remain in a pose for a longer length of time. [...] Modern yoga props help the yogi achieve optimum benefits from a pose regardless of age, flexibility level or experience."
.
Here ya go ğŸ˜œ Perching my crow high up on my handstand canes to achieve optimum benefits from it. No matter how old I am I truly enjoy playing with props and poses. Itâ€™s incredible fascinating how props change the experience of a long-known old friend like crow pose. It's almost like a we'd meet for the very first time ğŸ˜.
.
Happy good Friday to everyone. Itâ€™s a public holiday here in Germany. Where else in this world? ğŸ¤—
